InformationURL.Name: Van Allen Probes Science Gateway
InformationURL.Description: Science Gateway (including Mission Rules of the Road for Data Usage)

AccessInformation.Acknowledgement: NASA Space Physics Data Facility (SPDF) CDAWeb.
NASA Space Physics Data Facility (SPDF) CDAWeb.

Parameter.Name: Epoch
Parameter.Caveats: The midpoint of the sample time.

Parameter.Name: Satellite position (GEO)
Parameter.Description: [Time-series] Position of the satellite in geographic coordinates
Parameter.Caveats: Origin = Earths center of mass. X = Intersection of Greenwich meridian and geographic equator. Z = Geographic North Pole. Y = completes a right-handed Cartesian triad

Parameter.Name: Position_Quality
Parameter.Caveats: 0 denotes highest quality.

Parameter.Name: Magnetic field strength
Parameter.Caveats: Calculated using ONERA-DESP library Internal field: DGRF/IGRF External field: Olson & Pfitzer quiet

Parameter.Name: Equatorial magnetic field strength
Parameter.Description: ---> Calculated magnetic field strength at magnetic equator
Parameter.Caveats: Calculated using ONERA-DESP library Internal field: DGRF/IGRF External field: Olson & Pfitzer quiet

Parameter.Name: McIlwains L parameter
Parameter.Caveats: Calculated using ONERA-DESP library Internal field: DGRF/IGRF External field: Olson & Pfitzer quiet

Parameter.Name: Roederers L* parameter
Parameter.Caveats: Calculated using ONERA-DESP library Internal field: DGRF/IGRF External field: Olson & Pfitzer quiet

Parameter.Name: Adiabatic invariant (bounce)
Parameter.Caveats: Calculated using ONERA-DESP library Internal field: DGRF/IGRF External field: Olson & Pfitzer quiet

Parameter.Name: Magnetic Local Time
Parameter.Caveats: Calculated using ONERA-DESP library Internal field: DGRF/IGRF External field: Olson & Pfitzer quiet

Parameter.Name: Satellite position (GEO)
Parameter.Description: [Labels on plots] Position of the satellite in geographic coordinates
Parameter.Caveats: Origin = Earths center of mass. X = Intersection of Greenwich meridian and geographic equator. Z = Geographic North Pole. Y = completes a right-handed Cartesian triad

Parameter.Name: FEIO_2
Parameter.Description: FEIO - Omnidirectional Integral Electron Flux Detector 2
Parameter.Caveats: Electron flux for REPT detector 2 per spin.

Parameter.Name: FEIO_4
Parameter.Description: FEIO - Omnidirectional Integral Electron Flux Detector 4
Parameter.Caveats: Electron flux for REPT detector 4 per spin.

Parameter.Name: FEIO_9
Parameter.Description: FEIO - Omnidirectional Integral Electron Flux Detector 9
Parameter.Caveats: Electron flux for REPT detector 9 per spin.

Parameter.Name: FPIO_2
Parameter.Description: FPIO - Omnidirectional Integral Proton Flux Detector 2
Parameter.Caveats: Proton flux for REPT detector 2 per spin.

Parameter.Name: FPIO_4
Parameter.Description: FPIO - Omnidirectional Integral Proton Flux Detector 4
Parameter.Caveats: Proton flux for REPT detector 4 per spin.

Parameter.Name: FPIO_9
Parameter.Description: FPIO - Omnidirectional Integral Proton Flux Detector 9
Parameter.Caveats: Proton flux for REPT detector 9 per spin.

Parameter.Name: WX_DATA_VALID
Parameter.Caveats: For VALID = 1 all 3 conditions must be true: BIAS_ST: ON, Spin Phase: VALID, Spin Period: VALID for all 36 sectors.

Parameter.Name: REPT_INST_ID
Parameter.Description: Identifies which REPT instrument is the source of the data.
Parameter.Caveats: 0 indicates a breadboard test, 1 indicates the REPT-A instrument, 2 indicates the REPT-B instrument, 3 indicates EM.
